result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquis K Osborne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  All court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Pay by the end of supervison.  Failure  to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts two -four, but consecutive to any other sentence.  
Court finds defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and the WI. Substance Abuse program after two years confinement.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.

Follow al rules of supervision.  Follow through with any other treatment necessary by the department.
All applicable fees of supervision to be paid by end of supervision.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute, maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one, three and four; consecutive to any other sentence.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one, two and four; but consecutive to any other sentence.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one-three, but consecujtive to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript of SENTENCING HEARING (24 pages) commencing 05/06/2015 received and filed.

Defendant Marquis K Osborne in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Marquis K Osborne in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI reviewed and corrections made.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  7.5 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to Counts 2-4, but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  7.5 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to Counts 1, 3 & 4, but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  7.5 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to Counts 1, 2 & 4, but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

As to Count 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  7.5 YEARS with 0 days credit CONCURRENT to Counts 1-3, but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after 2 years confinement.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Letters in Support of the Defendant

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Letters in Support of the Defendant received and filed.

Attorney Matt Last in court, defendant Marquis K Osborne not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for sentencing, however Branch 22 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing Hearing on Monday, May 4, 2015 at 8:30 AM in BR 22, CH Rm 608 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.

Defendant Marquis K Osborne in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Marquis K Osborne in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
As to Counts 1-4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court Orders PSI report.  Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) signed and FILED.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matt Last in court, defendant Marquis K Osborne not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matt Last in court, defendant Marquis K Osborne not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marquis K Osborne in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Marquis K Osborne in custody.  Ronald Dague for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Kelly Zielinski-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: ALYSSA D.; MONICA Z.; DANIEL E.; EARNEST E.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marquis K Osborne in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Marquis K Osborne in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
